text: Hi. Thanks a lot for your feedback. This is exactly what I need. So you can build custom element etc using the existing datas but writing a new "part" of the system like we will do with a Typo3 Extension is not impossible
I imagine this is also not possible to host and install the CMs on a n internal server right?
How do you deal with deployment and stages? Like having a dev stage for the internal coordination, a staging for the communication with client etc?
Does anyone happen to know if the new email editor has an option to add a border to elements?
Related to this, are there any videos available that explain the new editor? Other than the general one inside the editor.

We’re consciously trying to avoid creating too many channels and fragmenting conversations.

That said I can see that channel potentially being useful long term. Will bring it up internally.

Hey there.
 I have maybe 2 dumb questions but
1. What is difference between "New file > HTML & HUBL" and "New theme"?
2. When I try to create a new theme from Boilerplate I get "There was an error creating "Boilerplate theme". What is wrong?
Thank you!

initially, i feel like it fits under the <#CF540P856|seo> umbrella, but i totally get that it would be nice that it had its own channel.  I may be partial, but i feel like this deserves a spot on the community forum
<@UDHT6N5SM> would you be willing to start a thread on this?>

<#CF540P856|seo> is definitely a part of it but what I had in mind has a lot of overlap with developer-tools, javascript, HubSpot limitations, ideas, local development…I see why you want to avoid creating too many channels. I’m happy to start a thread somewhere specific and list out the potential areas of discussion that this new channel  would support.
I think a lot of developers are struggling with what initially seems like a HubSpot heavy speed limitation but is turning out to be a knowledge gap

a “wiki” for the common questions that I don’t think have definite answers anywhere would be a nice start: what are the core files that HubSpot requires that you have to work around?, why does loading a contact form hurt performance so much?, why is loading chat even worse?…and more importantly, How do we get around these issues? What’s worth trying to improve? What cannot be improved without a HubSpot update?
maybe it would be something along the lines of #optimizing-performance (the fields of SEO, development, tools, workflows, etc. are forever being optimized)

Side note from this conversation:
Say Andrey have you gone through this guide?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed>

Curious if you have any thoughts or feedback
<@UD53A9UUR> let me know if you had anything specific in mind for a thread of can send me an example
I am thinking a general thread.  There is one example I am thinking of...need to find it.  Let me get back to you tomorrow

<@U7SL518D6> I did and it was helpful. I have a site in progress, due tomorrow that is scoring 90+ on mobile and desktop thanks to 25% this article and 75% googling for solutions to handle “unavoidable” HubSpot JS files
+ webpack has been a game changer for me
I think a lot of the stress for me is around hacking together solutions that drastically improve loading time.
Hacking because they don’t seem to be things that HubSpot recommends in docs like these
For sure!  I am feeling if we can all donate to a thread in the forums, we can get these ideas to the people who can make some changes!
Yea, I can make one that gathers the questions/answers that have been hardest to find and go from there. I’ll have to work on it over the weekend because of upcoming due dates
Now that we have local dev, everything is up in the air and a lot of what makes a page load faster is in our hands, but the more we can share ideas the better for all
PS. This isn't an assignment!
Right, I gotcha. I feel like I have to make up for all the questions and complaints by being helpful :slightly_smiling_face:
If you get the ball rolling, I promise I will help build the snowman
Enjoy that analogy :face_with_rolling_eyes:
ha
Please link to your thread
sounds good. As soon as I have time I’ll start gathering.
I’ll link and mention you
Thank you, kind sir!
Theme is <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes|a collection of assets> like modules, templates, styles, etc. HTML + HubL template is just a single page template.
